item.description:
Let's start the season off with an easy terrain playground. Tower Hill Pond offers a gorgeous scenery this time of year, complete with phonics produced by the ice/snow melting streams gurgling peaceful sounds on their way into the pond.

The trail to the pond and around the pond is about 3 miles, easy going and a great way to start off the season.

At a leasurely pace, complete with throwing sticks and talking, it can be completed in about 2 hours without breaking a sweat.

The area is only accessible by foot or bicycle - gifting visitors with a near serene nature experience.


DIRECTIONS:
Route 101 East
Exit 2
Right on Hooksett Road
1/4 mile up take a Left onto Old Candia Road --- drive by Smiley Veterinarian on Left hand side
1/4 mile another left under Route 101 OVERPASS ---- there's a house on the corner of this DIRT road

There are 3 places to park, drive to the 3rd one; about 1/2 mile up the road
Look for my car: Light Green Volvo Station Wagon; License plate eprint





Human Soles & Doggie Paws April Meeting at Tower Hill

I'll put a Meetup Sign where you have to take a left off of Old Candia Road

WANTED: Meetup Assistants - please let me know if you'd like to help me ensure the success of the group

Name Tags - I will bring some labels we can put on our clothes so we can learn each other's names better. I, for one am terrible with names and need all the help I can get!

Things you may consider bringing


  • Comfortable Walking/Hiking Shoes - waterproofed if you have.
  • Bug Spray
  • Water for you
  • Leash
  • Rain Coat
  • The more CAMERAS the better - I'd like to post Pix of our Meeting (with your permission, of course)


Things to bear in mind in general


  • Horses, bicycles, other walkers frequent the trail - we must share the space
  • Tower Hill feeds into Massabessic & therefore there is no swimming or wading signs posted everywhere. Fines can be issued if those rules are broken.
  • There are certain DISCREET areas where my poor clumsy Puppy always seems to fall into the water.



Note: I'm hoping the rain they are predicting is for later on during the day. I don't mind walking in a little misty rain, but not anything too heavy. Should Mother Nature not cooperate we'll have to reschedule.
The rule of thumb will be that if it's pouring at 1:30 pm then the meeting at Tower Hill will be rescheduled to May 25th.

I look forward to meeting everyone this weekend.

Christine
item.how_to_find_us: My super friendly, will roll over so you can see how friendly he is, Golden Retriever HUGO will find you first... most likely! Otherwise look for the puppy mobile with a NH license plate of "eprint". Directions under the windshield wipers, if late.
item.why: With Mother Nature's good blessing wouldn't it be great to fill a Lazy Sunday Afternoon with a relaxing walk with your four legged companion(s)? Since this is such a "Small World" don't be surprised to find someone you already know.

group.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws Hikers & Walkers of Manchester, NH

item.name: Human Soles & Doggie Paws April Meeting
